strong.span: Paper/Pencil Assignment Pickup and Drop off

p.span: The Greenville School District will be holding their paper/pencil assignment pickup and drop off on April 22, 2020 from 2:00 – 6:00 p.m. at the following locations:
– drive through at the front of the building
- Student last names: A – L at the front of the building
- Student last names: M-Z at the side gym entrance
School library books will also be collected at this time.
Parents are to remain in their vehicles at both locations and wait for a staff member to assist them.

Given the ongoing concerns for everyone’s safety, the GASD cafeteria is taking a new approach to meal distribution. Starting on Tuesday 3/24/20, meals will be distributed at the following (3) locations, times and days:
- Greenville High School, 9 Donation Road, 10 AM until Noon, Tuesdays and Fridays
- Hillside Presbyterian Church, 2 N. High Street, 10 AM until Noon, Tuesdays and Fridays
- Kennard United Methodist Church, 318 Groover Road, 10 AM until Noon, Tuesdays and Fridays

Individuals will be able to pick up meals for multiple days on each of the assigned pick-up days. We will continue with this distribution schedule until further notice. If you are driving, please remember to stay in your car during this pick up and do not come out if you are not feeling well
Given the information that the District has received to date, the following is our current plan with students and their in-home instruction and learning expectations.

span.span: o date, no instruction has officially started. If students have started on any of the assignments or work that has been picked up or posted on Google Classroom that is certainly fine but the District has not officially commenced this process.

p.span: As of the posting of this update, our anticipated start date to begin this process is Monday, March 30th.

Given the Governor’s most recently communicated state-wide expectations for closures, Greenville Schools, like all other schools throughout the state are closed for students until at least April 9th. As more information becomes available on both statewide expectations and our District’s plans for instruction we will update everyone accordingly.
